result.execSummary:
The defendant Krista M. Mertz-Pocha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for employment, childcare or counseling are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - stayed
Concurrent with: with 14CM491

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DA surcharge, and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CM491.

records.addlTxt: Wood County DNA Proof of Submission
Count 1 - probation

Defendant Krista M. Mertz in court with attorney Anne Renc. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM491 and 15CM303:
 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM491 Guilty
15CM303 Count 1 Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim was given notification for both files. No victim present today.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM491 and 15CM303 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CM303 Counts 2, & 3 are Dismissed and Read in.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc concurs with recommendation and requests warrants on these cases be quashed. 

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION****
14CM491: I/S Sentence
  90  days jail, concurrent with each other w/huber, employment, childcare or counseling  - stayed
18 months  Probation
Conditions:
- AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
- Pay court costs + DA surcharge + DNA surcharge each case.
- No abusive contact with Derek Mertz.  
- Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
- Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time as able to do so according to her disability.  
- Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
- Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
- Early discharge, if agent recommends.
1 day credit

15CM303:  I/S Sentence
  90 days jail, concurrent with 14CM491 w/huber, employment, childcare or counseling  - stayed
18 months  Probation, concurrrent with 14CM491:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 14CM491.
- Pay court costs + DA surcharge + DNA surcharge each case.
1 day credit

Warrants quashed in both cases.
Voluntary appearance at 10-30-2015 09:15 am

Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard at this time are 15CM-303 and 14CM-491.


1:52 PM Court calls case and states appearances.
Court reviews the file.
Defendant was to be here at 1:30 pm, it is now 1:52 pm.

Warrants that are outstanding will remain out there. The Court will take no action.
cc:da w/mins 09-18-15 ss
sent to JR 9/14/15 ks

Atty Drengler makes statements.
